rComments: Dard Neuman is passionate about what he's teaching. Lectures can be a bit boring though. As long as you show up and listen in class, you should easily pass. Show up everyday so you don't miss the pop quizzes. Everybody loves his classes. Great GE choices.

I LOVE Dard. He gives out quizzes every once in a while where you just have to answer to get credit and you can miss 2 and still get 100% in the quiz category. He is so passionate about this subject and he is a really great lecturer. There's something about his voice that's so soothing. His midterms and tests are easy too, just study the slides.

No homework. One midterm, one final. He gives pop quizzes which is like his attendance. But you can miss three quizzes and still get an A in that category. His pop quizzes is just to write a short answer to whatever he's teaching that day. There's no required reading for that class. I just went, took notes, and reviewed them for tests.
Pretty laid back teacher. Lectures can get boring at times. Going to class is a must as he occasionally assigns easy pop quizzes. Easy IM GE. Would recommend if your other classes require more time.

This class is both easy and great. Dard assigns readings, but honestly you don't need to read them to get a good grade. 30% of the class is based on pop quizzes, which are randomly at the end of a lecture. All you need to do is write a thoughtful response to the question(s) to get full credit. 30% of the class is the mid-term, and 40% is the final.

If you have the opportunity to take 80O with Neuman, do it immediately. Great GE, my favorite class of this quarter. He assigns readings every class and although they're interesting, they're effectively optional. He's SO helpful and will do everything he can to make sure you pass. Passionate and hilarious, Dard is a fantastic professor!!!
Easy GE class, lots of extra credit opportunities. Fun class. Take it.

Super interesting fellow. Music through political protest: really easy and interesting.He has a great talking voice, and is really engaged. Love how passionate he is about what he teaches. Lots of extra credit opportunities!

Attendance not mandatory, but if you want to do well on pop quizzes(15% of grd), I suggest going. Tests are from slides, which equaled over 400 for the final. I heard the class used to be easier, but he made it harder this year. No curve at all. NOT a "no brainer easy A" class.

Okay don't buy the books, he assigns reading but he tells you he'll never test you on it. Just show up to lecture and take a few notes and you'll do well. Tests are super straight forward. Random 1 point quizzes. Overall, great class to take for an easy A.

Easy passing, requires work to get an A. It is kind of unreasonable to expect students to know info of 250-300 slides. A lot of info covered. Only take it if you are really interested. 1 midterm, final, pop up quizzes and mandatory attendance.

He is really  passionate about music and all but when it comes to the final and the midterm, he expects you to memorize 300 slides. The pop quizzes he gives out are fairly easy if you actually go to lectures and pay attention in class.
He's really passionate about music, and the traditions in indian music, also he's just really attractive and has great stage presence.

Such a passionate man! Easy going and helpful teacher, has a sense of humor as well. Can be a bit repetitive but its beneficial in the end if you truly want to embody a subject he teaches like Indian music

Dard is a great teacher, he explains very well, definitely go to class because his lectures are more important than the slides. I took Music 80O as a GE and it was really good. No homework(don't bother with the readings, not important at all), easy quizzes, interesting class(and I'm a STEM major so I was kind of dreading this class) I reccommend it

Dard does a decent job getting the ideas across, more through his actual lecturing than the slides (which he mostly uses as cues for himself).  If you go to lecture and listen you'll do great! Random quizzes are very easy (mostly to make sure you attend), but their content re-surfaces almost word for word on the midterm and final!

Music of India was so fun! One of the best classes I have ever taken at UCSC! His lectures are very interesting, especially if you have intrest in Bollywood movies I recommend this class, Dard is an AMAZING professor, his test are easy if you study his slides, I definitely recommend this class for your CC GE!(: Plus there is no section BONUS!

Music of India with Dard is a super easy gen ed class. I never did a single reading, and missed many lectures(or attended high) but still got an A+ in the class. Study the slides before exams and be sure to practice responding to the short answer written portion. Dard is really great and helpful. Take this class! It's fun too

Dard Neuman is am amazing lecturer. In-class quizzes (I missed like five), two midterms (multiple choice and short answer). Short answer questions released before exams and are taken directly from the quizzes. Skip the reading, but thoroughly study the slides. However, the slides aren't put up until a few days before the exams. Grade: A.

Dard is awesome! He is clearly passionate about his teachings and always presents material in a well-organized, clear matter. He is easy going, laid back, and very insightful. He is also a beautiful sitar player and will break it out during class!
Dard is a very easy going professor.  He is passionate about teaching and loves to answer questions, but the class material is very borring.  all around easy class, take if you can!
Easy going personality, clear lectures.  Pop quizzes are for attendance points.  Nearly spells out everything you need to know for exams.  Low pressure, relaxing class - recommended.
Super nice guy and funny. Not necessary to go to class but fun to go occasionally. Midterm and final are easy. The syllabus adds up to 110%
Goes really off topic. You go to talk about all sorts of music and you get stuck behind his mask of Indian music, which is the only thing he actually talks about.

The only real complaint I have is that the lecture notes were posted online only a week before the exams--and they were at least 300 slides. The topics were interesting, but he did NOT keep on track with the syllabus, and didn't even get to emphasize the good stuff. And his lyrics usually don't match with the song! Good luck getting an A.

Do not take this class! Dard is nice but unfortunately being nice doesn't make you interesting, unbiased, or fair. He puts the most interesting material at the very end and never has enough time to get to it. His syllabus is misleading and his tests are HARD! He gives you his lecture slides (about 400 per test) and says, "Just know them all"

Do not take this class. This class should be called "Dard's Experience in India and random Political Pseudo-Intellectual Ramblings." Dard is arrogant and condescending, incredibly repetitive and focuses more on his own stories and interests than the course material. The course material has the potential to be very interesting and he made it bad.

Dard made me so mad!  He was a terrible teacher, because he did not stick to the syllabus. I took music as political protest, and was expecting some good music. However, he only played really esoteric Indian music, the music he did play was of a poor quality, and his tangents during lecture were worthless.   He needs to think less of himself.
Nice guy, really repetitive.  His class is harder than you think, you'll have to work hard for an A but to get a B you can totally slack off.  Nice GE class.

Extremely repetitive in his lectures. Almost as though he is talking down to the students, bringing up ridiculous points that should be common knowledge prior to the class many times. Not sure how someone could find him really attractive. Needs a stylist.

Class was fun and worth going to, not just bc of Dard's charm but also bc he made it fun, interesting, and sometimes performed for the class. Reading was posted on eres so no text needed to be bought. Tests were fairly easy as long as you studied the practice questions he provided and read over lecture notes.  Oh, and he's incredibly handsome!

Awesome professor and easy class. The subject matter wasn't quite what I expected but Dard made it interesting, though repetitive. All lecture notes were available online. The midterm and final were multiple choice and questions  taken directly from the lecture notes.

Dard was a really cool guy.  You don't need to go to lecture to do well on the tests because all his powerpoints and notes were online but i genuinely enjoyed going to class.  Class is comprised of 2 tests, so you don't need to do any outside work, also, he plays instruments a lot in class which is fun to listen to

The class was fairly easy and entertaining. Neuman has a personal understanding of the topic which is rare in the field. I wouldn't recommend taking the class if you don't have a specific interest in Hindustani music (which seems to the the problem of most of the naysayers here). I didn't do any reading, missed a couple classes, and still got an A.

besides being a SUPERBABE, lectures were useless. nice guy, genuinely interested in the subject, has real-world experience in it (which he LOVES to share with his numerous "stories"). class was a nice gen ed, but i wouldn't recommend him if you're looking for passion and spice within the classroom ;-)

Very good teacher, a few small pop quizzes worth 3% of the grade and the remainder on the mid-term and final (approx 40/60 split.)  Subject is interesting, and simply attending lecture you will wind up doing well in the class if you actually pay attention.  Very fun teacher to listen to.
My favorite lectures with Dard were the ones where he worn his white slacks.  They didn't leave much to the imagination.  It was hot.
His class was easy and I learned a lot. Dard was AWESOME! he has a great understanding for classical indian music.

This guy has a degree in Anthropology from Columbia so it figures he's teaching Music at UCSC right?  This class sucked, his tests were pretty difficult, I was expecting an easy A but no luck.  He literally gets a **** over talking about folk music, failed to cover much beyond that.

Music through Political Protest seemed like it would be a really interesting class, but it wasn't. He is really clear, but the class was really boring and didn't cover topics i thought would be involved. He talk WAY TOO MUCH about folk music of the early 1900's and barely touched on the music of the 60's & 70's. He could have done much better!

I loved this class, learned a ton. Dard is such a chill professor and gets really into his lectures. Funny guy and extremely handsome. I got a 95% on the midterm and a 93% on the final (which was worth 68% of the grade). No homework, a couple of little 1-paragraph reflections in-class. An easy A if you're into music, politics and protest.

Had fun in this clas. Dard is a BABE (especially when he wears sandals) and really funny and talented.  His test are not hard if you go to lecture. He really knows what he's talking about because he has lived the life.

well...to say the least, this class was a complete disapointment. i was very excited to take this course (i mean really, "music, politics and protest?"--how cool) but as it turns out...dard can't teach. really too bad if you ask me because he's a nice guy and i think he tries his best. his classes are just terrible. sadness.
A true Hottie! He makes lectures interesting and fun. Great teacher and extremely attractive!

he's a pretty decent guy, he presents a lot of pretty basic information but the tests can be a bit tricky, i recomend memorizing where the quotes come from. i recomend this class, plus he just seems like he's a really good husband and daddy...not that that helps but its still neat.
HOOTTTIIEEE

this guy is so boring..his reviews and going to class are useless..just read the material..he is very tricky with his tests..1 midterm is 40% of your grade, while final is 60%.this class sucked!overall not a great lecturer.dont take him!take music 80x with deepak.

Dard was a great, clear and helpful teacher.  He kept the lectures interesting and I feel like I learned way more in this class than all my other classes put together this quarter.  Dard is a great teac her to have at UCSC.

Music of India was a most boring class.  It was in large part due to Neuman being the professor.  I had heard of Deepak Ram's class being such an easy and fun class, however this guy tried to make Music of India as hard as he could.  Make sure you don't take Music 80X with Neuman!
Knew what he was talking about.  Lots of fun.  Good class and overall great guy.

The class was a let down. If you wanna know the life history of JOE HILL then take this class, if you wanted to learn about Dylan take this class for like 1 second. It was primarily aboot (i'm canadian) the 1930s protest****. It was boring, and the review for the tests sucked. So BEWARE!!!

i took this class because it takes care of 2 gen eds.  my mistake, i'd rather take 2 classes than this one. i mean, i took notes, read the book, went to class everyday, and read the readings online as well, yea hella work, feel me?  the lectures are boring, he doesnt respond to emails, and his voice is monotone so try stayin awake.
No Comments
Wonderful person and a great professor.  I love him!  Dresses well and loves the subject.
horrible teacher. not understanding. confusing. very unclear.

Neuman tried hard to be enthusiastic about the material, but he really doesnt have as much knowlledge about it as one would hope. It seemed almost as if they gave him the class to teach, so he read a couple books and regurgitated the information to us. If you want to take a good modern music class, take Am. Pop. Culture (Lit 80i) with Chude-Sokei.
I'll give him a break because he's a newbie, but his lectures were banal and superficial. Like the previous reviewer said, attendance at most lectures was unnecessary to pass the class.

who would have thought you could make a class called "music politics and protest" so boring students would not go, sleep through it, or just leave? if you go to the review day before a test you can get all the info from 1/2 the quarter in just 2 hours. learning nothing, bored blind, getting an A. worst class and biggest dissappointment.
